meta.name: Automated Amazon Stock Level Tracker with Bright Data MCP and OpenAI

parameters.text:
=below is the amazon product and you will scrape the page and tell whether it is still in stock or out of stock:
{{ $json['Product url'] }}

parameters.message: The product is out of stock so I need 50 more products
parameters.subject: =Product "{{ $json.output.product.title }}" is out of stock

parameters.content:
### üü© **SECTION 1: Input Setup & Trigger**

> **üì¶ What product to check, and how often to check it?**

#### üß© Nodes:

1. ‚è∞ **Check Stock Every X Hours** (Schedule Trigger)
2. ‚úèÔ∏è **Define Product URL & Threshold** (Edit Fields)

#### üß† What This Section Does:

* ‚è∞ The workflow is automatically triggered based on your chosen time interval (e.g., every 6 hours, every day, etc.).
* ‚úçÔ∏è You manually or dynamically input the **Amazon product URL** and optional values like desired stock threshold.

#### üßë‚Äçüè´ Why It‚Äôs Important:

This section **starts the whole process**. Instead of checking manually every day, this runs in the background automatically. If you want to monitor **multiple products**, you can later loop this over a Google Sheet.

---

### ü§ñ **SECTION 2: Scraping Product Data from Amazon**

> **üí° Check the current stock status of the product on Amazon.**

#### üß© Nodes:

1. ü§ñ **Scrape Product Data (via Agent)** (AI Agent)
2. üîå **OpenAI (Chat)** (OpenAI Chat Model)
3. üì± **Bright Data MCP (Scraper)** (MCP Client)
4. üß† **Parse Scraped Output** (Structured Output Parser)

#### üß† What This Section Does:

* Uses **AI Agent** to coordinate the scraping process.
* The **MCP Client** uses Bright Data's Mobile Carrier Proxy to load Amazon like a real user from a mobile device (this avoids blocks and sees mobile-specific info like ‚ÄúIn Stock‚Äù messages).
* The product page is scraped (title, price, availability, etc.).
* Finally, **Structured Output Parser** cleans the result into a usable format, like this:

  ```json
  {
    "availability": "In Stock",
    "title": "UGREEN USB Hub",
    "price": 9.98
  }
  ```

#### üßë‚Äçüè´ Why It‚Äôs Important:

You‚Äôre using **cutting-edge scraping** that mimics human behavior (via MCP), plus **AI** to understand and clean up the data. It saves you from dealing with messy HTML or blocked pages.

---

### üì¨ **SECTION 3: Decision & Notification**

> **‚ùì Is the product out of stock? If yes, alert supplier. If no, do nothing.**

#### üß© Nodes:

1. üß≠ **Product In Stock?** (If)
2. ‚õî **Do Nothing (Stock Available)** (No Operation)
3. üìß **Email Supplier (Out of Stock Alert)** (Gmail)

#### üß† What This Section Does:

* üß≠ It checks the parsed data for `"availability": "In Stock"`.
* ‚úÖ If it **is in stock**, the workflow ends silently. No need to disturb anyone.
* ‚ùå If it **is out of stock**, it triggers a **Gmail alert** to the supplier so they can take action quickly.

## I‚Äôll receive a tiny commission if you join Bright Data through this link‚Äîthanks for fueling more free content!

=======================================

## üîÑ Track Amazon Product Stock & Alert Supplier Workflow

**Purpose**: Automatically monitor an Amazon product and alert the supplier via Gmail if it's **out of stock**.

---

### üü© **SECTION 1: Input Setup & Trigger**

> **üì¶ What product to check, and how often to check it?**

#### üß© Nodes:

1. ‚è∞ **Check Stock Every X Hours** (Schedule Trigger)
2. ‚úèÔ∏è **Define Product URL & Threshold** (Edit Fields)

#### üß† What This Section Does:

* ‚è∞ The workflow is automatically triggered based on your chosen time interval (e.g., every 6 hours, every day, etc.).
* ‚úçÔ∏è You manually or dynamically input the **Amazon product URL** and optional values like desired stock threshold.

#### üßë‚Äçüè´ Why It‚Äôs Important:

This section **starts the whole process**. Instead of checking manually every day, this runs in the background automatically. If you want to monitor **multiple products**, you can later loop this over a Google Sheet.

---

### ü§ñ **SECTION 2: Scraping Product Data from Amazon**

> **üí° Check the current stock status of the product on Amazon.**

#### üß© Nodes:

1. ü§ñ **Scrape Product Data (via Agent)** (AI Agent)
2. üîå **OpenAI (Chat)** (OpenAI Chat Model)
3. üì± **Bright Data MCP (Scraper)** (MCP Client)
4. üß† **Parse Scraped Output** (Structured Output Parser)

#### üß† What This Section Does:

* Uses **AI Agent** to coordinate the scraping process.
* The **MCP Client** uses Bright Data's Mobile Carrier Proxy to load Amazon like a real user from a mobile device (this avoids blocks and sees mobile-specific info like ‚ÄúIn Stock‚Äù messages).
* The product page is scraped (title, price, availability, etc.).
* Finally, **Structured Output Parser** cleans the result into a usable format, like this:

  ```json
  {
    "availability": "In Stock",
    "title": "UGREEN USB Hub",
    "price": 9.98
  }
  ```

#### üßë‚Äçüè´ Why It‚Äôs Important:

You‚Äôre using **cutting-edge scraping** that mimics human behavior (via MCP), plus **AI** to understand and clean up the data. It saves you from dealing with messy HTML or blocked pages.

---

### üì¨ **SECTION 3: Decision & Notification**

> **‚ùì Is the product out of stock? If yes, alert supplier. If no, do nothing.**

#### üß© Nodes:

1. üß≠ **Product In Stock?** (If)
2. ‚õî **Do Nothing (Stock Available)** (No Operation)
3. üìß **Email Supplier (Out of Stock Alert)** (Gmail)

#### üß† What This Section Does:

* üß≠ It checks the parsed data for `"availability": "In Stock"`.
* ‚úÖ If it **is in stock**, the workflow ends silently. No need to disturb anyone.
* ‚ùå If it **is out of stock**, it triggers a **Gmail alert** to the supplier so they can take action quickly.

#### üßë‚Äçüè´ Why It‚Äôs Important:

This is your **automation trigger**. It helps suppliers restock faster and ensures your business doesn't run into product shortages.

---

## üß© Summary View (with Icons)

```
‚è∞ Schedule ‚Üí ‚úçÔ∏è Input Fields
        ‚Üì
ü§ñ AI Agent ‚Üí üì± MCP Scraper ‚Üí üß† Output Parser
        ‚Üì
üß≠ IF ‚Üí ‚ùå Do Nothing (In Stock)
         ‚Üí üìß Email Supplier (Out of Stock)
```

---

### üí° Beginner Tip:

If you ever want to monitor **many products**, replace the ‚ÄúEdit Fields‚Äù with a **Google Sheets node** that loops over each row ‚Äî totally no-code-friendly!
